Class AppointmentBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • AppointmentBook

  • public class AppointmentBook
extends java.lang.Object
    The AppointmentBook class is a wrapper class for the Appointment class. It acts as a management class for multiple appointments grouped together.
    Author:
    14061121

      Constructor for the AppointmentBook object.

      findAndReturn(String appointmentName) similar to find(Appointment appointmentToFind) except it will return the Appointment object if found.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AppointmentBook

        public AppointmentBook(java.lang.String appointmentBookName)
        Constructor for the AppointmentBook object. Requires a name for the AppointmentBook so that in the event of multiple AppointmentBook objects they can be logically distinguished from one another by the user.
        Parameters:
        appointmentBookName - The logical name of the newly created AppointmentBook object.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public int add(Appointment newAppointment)
        Adds a new Appointment object to the appointmentList maintained by the AppointmentBook class.
        Parameters:
        newAppointment - The new Appointment object to add.
        Returns:
        Returns an integer value depending on if the new Appointment object was successfully added to the AppointmentBook. If the Appointment to add already exists then a positive value will be returned. If the new Appointment clashes with an exiting appointment then a -1 negative value will be returne. If appointment is added successfully then a 0 is returned.

      • intialiseAppointmentBookFromDatabase

        public void intialiseAppointmentBookFromDatabase()
        intialiseAppointmentBookFromDatabase() takes the logical name of the AppointmentBook object and uses it to initialise the current AppointmentBook object's appointmentList.

      • getAllAppointments

        public java.util.ArrayList<Appointment> getAllAppointments()
        getAllAppointments() returns all the Appointment objects for the AppointmentBook object as an ArrayList.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList object containing all the Appointments for the AppointmentBook.

      • showAllAppointments

        public void showAllAppointments()
        showAllAppointments() prints all Appointment objects managed by the AppointmentBook object to the System.out.*.

      • find

        public int find(Appointment appointmentToFind)
        find(Appointment appointmentToFind) searches through the AppointmentBook objects ArrayList of Appointment objects for one whose toString() output matches that of the supplied appointmentToFind's toString() output. This is not effective. Needs heavy reconsideration.
        Parameters:
        appointmentToFind - the Appointment object to find.
        Returns:
        1 if found and 0 if not found.

      • findAndReturn

        public Appointment findAndReturn(java.lang.String appointmentName)
        findAndReturn(String appointmentName) similar to find(Appointment appointmentToFind) except it will return the Appointment object if found. This is not effective. Needs heavy reconsideration.
        Parameters:
        appointmentName - the name of the Appointment object to find.
        Returns:
        returns the Appointment which has a matching name to appointmentName parameter or null if not found.

      • remove

        public void remove(Appointment appointmentToRemove)
        Checks if the Appointment object that wants to be removed exists in the current AppointmentBook and removes it if it does.
        Parameters:
        appointmentToRemove - the Appointment object to remove.

      • isInBook

        public boolean isInBook(Appointment appointmentToCheck)
        Method to check if an Appointment object exists in the AppointmentBook.
        Parameters:
        appointmentToCheck - the Appointment object to check for.
        Returns:
        true if the item does exist in the AppointmentBook otherwise, returns false;

      • checkForTimeClash

        public int checkForTimeClash(Appointment appointmentToCheck)
        Check to see if the supplied Appointment object's times clash with an existing Appointment object.
        Parameters:
        appointmentToCheck - the Appointment to check against the existing Appointments in the AppointmenBook.
        Returns:
        -1 if the times clash or 0 if not.

      • SetAppointmentBookName

        public void SetAppointmentBookName(java.lang.String name)
        Set the logical name of the AppointmentBook.
        Parameters:
        name - the logical name to set.

      • saveAppointmentsToDatabase

        public void saveAppointmentsToDatabase()
        Saves the AppointmeBook's appointmentList to the DB by force. Rarely used as the updating of the DB should happen seamlessly on the go (in reality it is far more buggy than this and needs revising).
